guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • Arduino Duemilanove microcontroller Maker Shed MKSP4.
  • Nerf N-Strike Vulcan EBF-25 Dart Blaster
  • Insulated stranded hookup wire 22-gauge
  • Power supply 6V–12V DC 1A–1.5A
Tools
  • Soldering iron
  • Wire stripper cutter

parts.text: Arduino Duemilanove microcontroller Maker Shed MKSP4.
Nerf N-Strike Vulcan EBF-25 Dart Blaster

lines.text: Unscrew all of the small philips head screws holding the Nerf gun together. Be sure to save the screws for reassembly later.
lines.text_raw: Unscrew all of the small philips head screws holding the Nerf gun together. Be sure to save the screws for reassembly later.

lines.text: Carefully open the case so you can get to the wiring of the safety switch.
lines.text_raw: Carefully open the case so you can get to the wiring of the safety switch.

lines.text: With the trigger pulled, the safety switch acts as a secondary trigger, one that can be thrown with a relay, which is what we'll do.
lines.text_raw: With the trigger pulled, the safety switch acts as a secondary trigger, one that can be thrown with a relay, which is what we'll do.

guide.summary: Build an autonomous Nerf sentry gun that can detect targets with an ultrasonic rangefinder and blast them with foam darts.
guide.title: Arduino Nerf Sentry Gun
